Class BackProp

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackProp

  • public class BackProp
extends java.lang.Object
    BackProp - a backpropagation neural network class 4/98 by Jason Tiscione.
    Copyright (c) 1998. All Rights Reserved. You have a non-exclusive, royalty free, LICENSE to use, modify and redistribute this software in source and binary code form, provided that 1) this dubious legal junk at the top appears on all copies of the software; and ii) you don't use the software in a manner which is "disparaging" to me- like making fun of the way I program. This software is provided "AS IS," with no warranty of any kind. NO MATTER WHAT, you can't sue me for anything. This software is neither designed nor intended to be used for air traffic control or for maintaining a nuclear facility, so don't get any crazy ideas.
    SUMMARY OF CLASS MEMBER VARIABLES:
    int R = size (# elements) of an input vector accepted by network
    int S1,S2,S3 = number of neurons in input, hidden, output layers
    double W1[][],W2[][],W3[][] = weight matrices of input, hidden, output layers
    double b1[][],b2[][],b3[][] = bias values of input, hidden, output layers
    int epoch= number of training presentations so far
    double lr= learning rate [default 0.01]
    double im= learning rate increase [default 1.05]
    double dm= learning rate decrease [default 0.7]
    double mc= momentum coefficient [default 0.9]
    double er= maximum error ratio [default 1.04]
    (The following variables are not used until trainInit() is called)
    int Q = number of training inputs
    double SSE = sum squared error
    double MC = current momentum
    double out1[][],out2[][],out3[][] = output from input, hidden, output layers
    double d1[][],d2[][],d3[][] = delta log array, for calculating dWn and dbn
    double dW1[][],dW2[][],dW3[][] = weight matrix differentials
    double db1[][],db2[][],db3[][] = bias matrix differentials
    double errors[][] = error matrix
    double inputs[][] = training inputs matrix
    double targets[][] = training targets matrix (usually an nxn identity matrix).

      • BackProp

        public BackProp(int R,
                int S1,
                int S2,
                int S3)
        This constructor simply takes as parameters the number of elements in each input vector and the number of neurons in the input, hidden, and output layers. It invokes the main constructor with default values for its remaining parameters.
        Parameters:
        R - Size (# elements) of an input vector accepted by network
        S1 - Number of neurons in input layer
        S2 - Number of neurons in hidden layer
        S3 - Number of neurons in output layer

    • Method Detail

      • testNet

        public double[][] testNet(double[] inputVector)
        Used to test the network on a single given input. It is merely a convenience method; this version of testNet() - there are two - takes a 1-dimensional array (containing a single input vector) as its sole argument, converts it from double[] to double[][], and passes it to the other version of testNet (which should preferably be used instead of this one.) The argument to this method should contain R elements. It returns a double[][] with S3 rows and one column.
        Parameters:
        inputVector - A single input vector, with R elements.
        Returns:
        Matrix of network outputs.

      • testNet

        public double[][] testNet(double[][] test_inputs)
        Used to test the network on a given input or inputs. The argument is an array of inputs. It must have R rows. The number of columns is arbitrary but must be at least one. This method will return an output array with S3 rows and the same number of columns that the double[][] argument has.

        Inputs to the network are constrained to the interval [0,1]; to use this class with inputs that span a different range, a scaling algorithm would need to be applied to the inputs and targets before calling this method or trainInit().

        The trainInit() method (at least) should be called before invoking testNet().

        Parameters:
        test_inputs - A double[][] matrix of network inputs
        Returns:
        A double[][] matrix of network outputs

      • trainInit

        public boolean trainInit(double[][] inputs,
                         double[][] targets)
        Establishes what the training inputs and targets are to be, and prepares the network for subsequent calls to trainNet(). This method need be called only once.

        The inputs[][] variable is set to the first argument, and so it must have R rows and a number of columns which is at least one. The number of columns establishes Q, the number of inputs. The targets[][] variable is set to the second argument and so that must have S3 rows and Q columns. If the number of columns in the two arguments are not the same, or if the arguments do not have R and S3 rows respectively, the method returns false. The individual input vectors and corresponding target vectors used to train the network are thus the column vectors in the inputs[][] and targets[][] arrays. All neuron activations in this network are constrained to the interval [0,1] by a log-sigmoid function. Inputs to the network are also constrained to this interval; to use this class with a set of inputs that span a different range, a scaling algorithm would need to be applied to the inputs and targets before calling this method or testNet().

        Parameters:
        inputs - A double[][] matrix of network inputs
        targets - A double[][] matrix of target network outputs
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating successful invocation.

      • trainNet

        public double trainNet()
        Performs ONE iteration (i.e., one epoch) of the backpropagation algorithm on the network. It updates the weight and bias arrays of the network, and returns the sum squared error of the network's output in comparison to the target array.
        Returns:
        The SSE (sum-sqared error) of the network's output.

      • getepoch

        public int getepoch()
        //@return Number of training epochs performed so far on the network

      • getWeightMatrix

        public double[][] getWeightMatrix(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - Integer specifying which layer's weight matrix you want. (1 for input layer, 2 for hidden layer, 3 for output layer)
        Returns:
        A double[][] matrix containing the current weight matrix of layer n (has Sn rows, and S(n-1) columns- or R columns if n=1)

      • getBiasVector

        public double[][] getBiasVector(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - Integer specifying which layer's bias vector you want. (1 for input layer, 2 for hidden layer, 3 for output layer)
        Returns:
        double[][] containing the current bias vector of layer n (has Sn rows, one column)
